author:
Jon Wilner

jwilner@mercurynews.com
title: Matchup: Stanford vs. UCLA
text:
Posted: 10/14/2015 05:39:56 PM PDT Updated: 10/14/2015 10:25:59 PM PDT no. 15 STANFORD VS. no. 18 ucla Records: Stanford 4-1, 3-0 Pac-12. UCLA 4-1,1-1. 
kickoff: 7:30 p.m. at Stanford Stadium 
tv/radio: ESPN/1050 
series history: UCLA leads 45-38-3; Stanford has won seven in a row. 
storylines: The winner stays comfortably in the hunt for a berth in the College Football Playoff. The loser is pushed to the fringe. ... The Cardinal, which has four of its final six league games at home, would take control of the North, at least temporarily, with a victory. ... Stanford has dominated the series of late, winning seven in a row by an average of 18 points. ... The Bruins lost three all-league defenders to season-ending injuries and have allowed 545 yards rushing in the past two games. Stanford is fourth in the conference in rushing (210 ypg). ... Stanford's revamped defense faces a freshman quarterback for the fourth time this season. Josh Rosen, who wanted to attend Stanford but was not offered a scholarship, is a huge talent but erratic. ... The Bruins have won 12 in a row away from home, the last loss coming at Oregon in 2013. ... Stanford is favored by 6ï»¿1/2 points. 
INJURY UPDATE: Stanford -- LB Noor Davis (leg), DT Harrison Phillips (knee) and LB Kevin Anderson (undisclosed) are out. DL Nate Lohn (undisclosed) is probable. UCLA -- LB Myles Jack (knee), CB Fabian Moreau (foot) and DL Eddie Vanderdoes (knee) are out. 
matchup to watch: UCLA tailback Paul Perkins against Stanford's run defense. ... Perkins is fourth in the conference in rushing (115.4 yards per game), while the Cardinal defense is second in run defense (129.6). ... The outcome of first-down runs will set the tone for the UCLA attack and either take the pressure off, or heap more pressure on, Rosen. ... If Perkins churns for 5 or 6 yards per carry, the Bruins should have their way. Advertisement 
stats that matter: Something has to give: Stanford's David Shaw is 5-0 against UCLA. UCLA's Jim Mora is 5-0 after a bye. ... The Cardinal leads the conference in third-down conversions (47.7 percent). UCLA is fourth (42.9 percent). ... The Cardinal is 42-4 under Shaw when leading at halftime. ... UCLA has won five in a row against ranked opponents. -- JON WILNER
